gurmukhi: inp syvk lO ien sMg cl cil ko paur pO AwXo ]AY kY khXy niRp ky Gr hO iqh qy sB gwcn sIs JkwXy ]
transliteration: Nrip Sevak Lai In San Chadyo Chal(i) Kai Nrip Kans Ke Paur Pai Aayo|| Ai Kai Kahyo Nrip Ko Ghar Hai Tih Te Sabh Gvaaran Sees Jhoukaayo||
translation: The servant of the king brought all these people (Krishna and his companions) in the palace of king Kansa; he told all of them that this is the house of the king, therefore all the gopas bowed their heads in veneration;

gurmukhi: Awgy ipKXy gj m`q mhwN khXy dUr kry gjvwn irswXy ]pwie prXy hih aUpih XyN mny ky aUpih pwp isDwXy ]845]
transliteration: Ooge Pikhyo Gad Matt Mahaan Kahyo Door Daro Gadvaan Risaayo|| Dhaae Daryo Har(i) Oopar Yon Mano Pounn Ke Oopar(i) Paap Sidhaayo||845||
translation: They saw before them an intoxicated elephant and the mahout is asking all of them to get away; the elephant speedily fell upon Krishna in such a way just as the vice falls upon the virtue in order to destroy it.845.

gurmukhi: kyp Bry gjmq mhwN Br suf ley Bt sudr syaU ]sy qb hI Gn sy grjXy ijhrI sm au`pm n kyaU ]
transliteration: Kop Bhare Gadmatt Mahaan Bhar Sound Lae Bhat Soundar Sooo|| So Tab Highan So Gadjyo Jihkisam Ouppam Aur Na Kooo||
translation: The elephant angrily entrapped both beautiful warriors (Krishna and Balram) in his trunk and began to roar in a unique way;

gurmukhi: pyt qry iqh ky pshy kib sXwm khY bipXw Ar jyaU ]XyN aupjI aupmw ijX mY Apny ihp sy mny Kylq dyaU ]846]
transliteration: Pet Dare Tih Ke Pasre Kabi Syaam Kahai Badheeyaa Ar Jooo|| Yon Oupjioupmaa Jiya Mai Apne Rip So Mano Khelat Dooo||846||
translation: Both the brother, who are the killers of the enemies, began to swing under the belly of the elephant and appeared to be busy in playing with the enemy.846.

gurmukhi: kypu krXy mn mY hirjU iqh ky qb dwNq auKwr lXy hY ]eyk deI gj suMf ibKY kuip dUsr sIs ky bIc dXy hY ]
transliteration: Kop(u) Daryo Man Mai Har(i)joo Tih Ko Tab Daant Oukhaar Layo Hai|| Ek Daigad Sound Bikhai Koup(i) Doosar Sees Ke Beech Dayo Hai||
translation: Then, Krishna, in great rage, extirpated the tusk of the elephant; he made another attack on the trunk of the elephant and the second attack on his head;

gurmukhi: cyt lgY isr bIc GnI DrnI pr sy murJwie pXy hY ]sy mr gXy irp ky vD ky mburw hUM ky Awrm Awj BXy hY ]847]
transliteration: Chot Lagad Sir Beech Ghanidharnidar So Murjhaae Payo Hai|| So Mar Gyo Rip Ke Badh Ko Mathuraa Hoon Ko Aagad Aaj Bhayo Hai||847||
translation: Because of the dreadful blow, the elephant became lifeless and fell on the earth; the elephant died and it seemed that Krishna had entered Mathura on that day in order to kill Kansa.847.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm skMDy bicqR nwtr gRMQy hiRSnw Avqwry gj bpih Dxwie smwpq ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sakandhe Bachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaa Avtdare Gad Badhah(i) Dhyaae Samaapt||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of the elephant” in Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh) in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of the battle with Chandur and Mushitak

gurmukhi: kMD DrXo gj dwNq auKwrkY bIc gey rMg BUm ky doaU ]bIrn bIr bfoeI ipKXo blvwn lKXo ien m`ln soaU ]
transliteration: Kandh Ddaryo Gad Daant Oukhaar-kai Beech Gad Ran Bhoom Ke Dooo|| Bderan Beer Badoipikhyo Balvaan Lkhyo In Mallan Sooo||
translation: After extirpating the tusk of the elephant and placing it upon the shoulder, both the brothers reached at the (newly set-up) stage; the warriors saw them as mighty warriors and the wrestlers at that place considered them as very sturdy;

gurmukhi: swDn dyiK kKXo krqw jg Xw sm dUsr Aaur n koaU ]qwq lKXo krkY lrkw niRp kMs lKXo mn mY Gir KoaU ]848]
transliteration: Saadhan Dekh(i) Lakhyo Kartaa Jag Yaa Sam Doosar Aur Na Kooo|| Taat Lakhyo Karkai Larkaa Nrip Kans Lakhyo Man Mai Ghar(i) Khooo||848||
translation: The saints considering them unique, visualised them as the creators of the world; the father saw them as sons and to king Kansa, they seemed as destroyers of his house.848.

gurmukhi: qO niRp bYT sBw hU ky BIqr m`ln so sdurwie lrwXo ]must ky swQ lrXo muslI su cMfUr so sXwm jU ju`Du mcwXo ]
transliteration: Tau Nrip Baith Sabhaa Hoo Ke Bheetar Mallan So Saduraae Laraayo|| Moust Ke Saath Daryo Mouslisu Channdoor So Syaam Joo Juddh(u) Machadyo||
translation: Sitting in the assembly, the king caused Krishna, the king of Yadavas to fight with his wrestlers; Balram fought with the wrestler named Mushitak and on this side Krishna fought with Chandur;

gurmukhi: BUim prY rn kI igir so hir jo mn BIqr kopu bFwXo ]eyk lgI n qhw Gtkw DrnI pr qwkhu mwr igrwXo ]849]
transliteration: Bhoum(i) Darai Ran Kigir(i) So Har(i) Jo Man Bheetar Kop(u) Badhaayo|| Ek Lagina Tahaa Ghatkaa Dharnidar Taakauh Maar Giraayo||849||
translation: When Krishna became infuriated, all these wrestlers fell on the earth like mountains and Krishna killed them in a very short time.849.
